sections.text:
RCW 62A.9A-603

Agreement on standards concerning rights and duties.

(a) Agreed standards. The parties may determine by agreement the standards measuring the fulfillment of the rights of a debtor or obligor and the duties of a secured party under a rule stated in RCW 62A.9A-602 if the standards are not manifestly unreasonable.(b) Agreed standards inapplicable to breach of peace. Subsection (a) of this section does not apply to the duty under RCW 62A.9A-609 to refrain from breaching the peace.

(a) Agreed standards. The parties may determine by agreement the standards measuring the fulfillment of the rights of a debtor or obligor and the duties of a secured party under a rule stated in RCW 62A.9A-602 if the standards are not manifestly unreasonable.

(b) Agreed standards inapplicable to breach of peace. Subsection (a) of this section does not apply to the duty under RCW 62A.9A-609 to refrain from breaching the peace.

[2000 c 250 s 9A-603.]
